title: Sam Altman on GPT-4 and OpenAI's Future
thread:
Sam Altman just revealed OpenAI's master plan and it's not what anyone expected
---
In his latest interview, he admitted GPT-4 was "embarrassingly bad" compared to what's coming. But here's the kicker - they're not just building better AI
---
They're building AGI that can do scientific research. Altman says we're 2-3 years away from AI that can cure diseases on its own
---
The craziest part? OpenAI is already testing GPT-5 internally. And according to insiders, it makes GPT-4 look like a toy

title: How Nvidia Became a $3 Trillion Company
thread:
Nvidia was almost bankrupt in 1997. Today they're worth $3 trillion. The story of how Jensen Huang pulled this off is insane
---
In 1997, Nvidia had 3 months of cash left. Their graphics chips were failing. Jensen made a desperate pivot to something called 'GPU computing'
---
Everyone thought he was crazy. "Why would anyone need parallel processing?" they said. Then AI happened. And Nvidia had the only chips that could handle it
---
Today, every AI company on Earth needs Nvidia chips. They control 80% of the AI chip market. Jensen Huang saw the future 25 years early

title: SpaceX Starship - The Mars Mission Reality
thread:
SpaceX just did something everyone said was impossible - caught a 230-foot rocket booster with mechanical arms. Here's why this changes everything
---
The Starship booster weighs 300 tons and was falling at 500mph. SpaceX caught it like a baseball. This isn't just cool - it's revolutionary
---
Why? Because it makes Mars colonization actually affordable. Catching and reusing boosters cuts launch costs by 99%. We can now send 150 tons to Mars for $2 million
---
Elon's timeline: First cargo missions to Mars in 2026. First humans in 2028. It sounds crazy until you realize SpaceX has hit every major milestone so far

title: The AI That's Solving Protein Folding
thread:
Google's DeepMind just solved a 50-year-old problem in biology. Their AI can now predict how proteins fold with 90% accuracy. Here's why this is huge
---
Proteins are the machines that run your body. But we couldn't predict their shapes from DNA. It's like having blueprints but not knowing what the building looks like
---
AlphaFold changed that overnight. It solved 200 million protein structures in 18 months. Scientists used to spend years solving just one
---
Now we can design new medicines in days instead of decades. Cancer drugs, antibiotics, even plastic-eating enzymes. This is the biggest breakthrough in biology since DNA

title: Why Tech Giants Are Betting Everything on AI Agents
thread:
Microsoft, Google, and Meta are all racing to build AI agents. But not for the reason you think. The real goal will blow your mind
---
They're not building chatbots. They're building digital workers that can use computers like humans. Book flights, write code, do research - all autonomously
---
Satya Nadella let it slip: "In 5 years, every person will have an AI agent doing 80% of their work." That's 1.5 billion jobs being transformed
---
The wildest part? These agents can work 24/7, never make mistakes, and cost $20/month. We're about to see the biggest labor shift in human history
